content: How can I help you today?

This is my first time here, so I’m not really sure how to start... I’ve been feeling overwhelmed recently, especially with everything happening at home. My wife and I have been struggling, and it’s affecting how I function at work and how I’m there for my son and daughter. I just don’t know what to do.

Thank you for sharing that—it sounds like things feel heavy for you right now, especially with what’s going on at home. It can be tough when stress in one area starts to spill over into others, like work or family. Would you like to share a bit more about what’s been overwhelming for you lately?

I think a lot of it stems from my son—he’s been having a lot of behavioral issues, and my wife and I can’t seem to agree on how to handle it. It’s created so much tension between us, and I feel like I’m failing as a husband and a father. It’s hard to focus on anything else when it feels like everything is falling apart.

You're carrying a lot right now—trying to manage the challenges with your son while also navigating the tension with your wife. It sounds like you deeply care about being there for your family, but you're feeling disconnected and unsure of how to move forward. How do you usually handle stress when things become overwhelming?

Honestly, I don’t think I’ve really been handling it. I just shut down. I tried distracting myself with work, but now I can’t even focus on that anymore. It’s like I’m stuck, and I don’t know how to get out of it.

Feeling stuck can be so frustrating, especially when distractions like work aren’t helping anymore. It sounds like you're searching for a sense of calm or control but haven’t found something that truly works for you yet. What do you think might help you feel more grounded or supported right now?
I really don’t know. I’ve been trying to juggle everything, and it feels like there’s no time to even think about what I need. Maybe just having someone listen and help me figure this out is a start.

It’s completely understandable to feel like there’s no space for yourself when you’re juggling so much. Finding that time to reflect and explore what you need is such an important step, and it’s great that you’re open to starting here. What do you feel would be most helpful to focus on in this moment?

I think the biggest thing is figuring out how to help my son and reduce the stress at home. If we can get to a better place as a family, maybe everything else will feel less overwhelming. But the truth is, I feel lost on where to even begin with that.

It sounds like you're really committed to supporting your son and bringing more peace into your family life. That’s a powerful starting point, even if you’re feeling lost right now. Maybe we can explore together some small steps or approaches that might help things feel more manageable at home. What do you think?
Yeah, I think that would be helpful. I just need any kind of starting point because right now, it all feels too big and like I’m failing.

That feeling of failure can really weigh on you—especially when you care so deeply about your family. But even reaching out today shows how much you’re trying, and that effort matters. Before we dive into exploring next steps, is there anything else weighing on you right now that you’d like to talk about first?
I think the biggest thing is just the fear of losing my family. It feels like everything is slipping away, and I don’t know how to hold it all together. It weighs on me every single day.

That fear sounds so heavy. It shows how much your family means to you and how hard you're trying to keep things together. You're carrying a lot, but it's clear you're willing to face these worries and work toward change. Would it help if we spent some time figuring out what small changes might start to make things feel less overwhelming for you and your family?
Yeah, I think that would help. I feel like small steps are all I can handle right now. I just want to feel like I’m doing something to move in the right direction.

That’s a really thoughtful place to begin—taking small steps can be powerful when things feel overwhelming. To start, would you say there are moments, even small ones, where things seem to work better at home or when you feel more connected with your family? That could help us identify something to build on.

Hmm, well, there are moments when my wife and I manage to talk calmly, like when the kids are asleep. And sometimes, when my son isn’t acting out, we have little moments where we can laugh or just sit together. Those times feel rare, but they do happen.

Those moments sound really meaningful. Even if they feel rare, they show that connection and calm are still possible, and that’s something worth holding onto. Looking at those times, what do you think helped make them feel more peaceful or positive?

I think it’s when there’s no pressure—when we’re just sitting together, not trying to fix anything or deal with problems. It’s like, for a little bit, everything feels normal, and I can just enjoy being around my family. Those times don’t last long, but I wish they did.

It's powerful that those moments bring a sense of peace and connection for you, even if they’re brief. It sounds like creating space without pressure could be an important way to build on those positive feelings. Would focusing on ways to nurture those kinds of moments be something that feels doable right now?
